de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.examples.nes

Class AccelerationPhaseDetection

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.examples.nes.AccelerationPhaseDetection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetworkDataSink

    public class AccelerationPhaseDetection
extends java.lang.Object
implements NetworkDataSink
    This class may be used to detect forth-and-back movements in the z-axis of linear acceleration of a device. The movement is expected to return to the original position. Users may subscribe to the detected movements using an AccelerationPhaseDetection.AccelerationListener.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  AccelerationPhaseDetection.AccelerationListener
      This interface must be implemented if you want to be notified of the detected movements

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean mDownCycle
      True if we are currently in a down movement cycle
      private AccelerationPhaseDetection.AccelerationListener mListener
      The listener we call back when a cycle begins
      private boolean mPhase2
      State variables determining the current state of a movement.
      private boolean mPhase3
      State variables determining the current state of a movement.
      private int mTimeoutCounter
      This counter is used for aborting phase waits, avoiding bad recognition of the next event due to delays in finishing the current events
      private boolean mUpCycle
      True if we are currently in an up movement cycle
      private static int TIMEOUT
      This is the maximum event count the detector will wait until the current cycle is aborted.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AccelerationPhaseDetection(AccelerationPhaseDetection.AccelerationListener listener)
      Create a new acceleration phase detection class.

      Get the different threshold values for detecting phase switches

      This function tries to detect whether the current conditions are sufficient to either enter a cycle or advance the current movement phase

      • mTimeoutCounter

        private int mTimeoutCounter
        This counter is used for aborting phase waits, avoiding bad recognition of the next event due to delays in finishing the current events

        This is the maximum event count the detector will wait until the current cycle is aborted.

        private boolean mDownCycle
        True if we are currently in a down movement cycle

      • mPhase2

        private boolean mPhase2
        State variables determining the current state of a movement. True if the phase is currently live.

      • mPhase3

        private boolean mPhase3
        State variables determining the current state of a movement. True if the phase is currently live.

        public void onData(NetworkDevice networkDevice,
                   SensorData sensorData,
                   float userSensitivity)
        Called whenever new data arrives from a device
        Specified by:
        onData in interface NetworkDataSink
        Parameters:
        networkDevice - where the data stems from
        sensorData - the sensor data
        userSensitivity - currently ignored to simplify detection

      • getThreshold

        private float getThreshold()
        Get the different threshold values for detecting phase switches
        Returns:
        one of three different thresholds, depending on the expected amplitude

      • onData

        private void onData(boolean up,
                    boolean down)
        This function tries to detect whether the current conditions are sufficient to either enter a cycle or advance the current movement phase
        Parameters:
        up - true, if the current data exceeds the movement threshold
        down - true, if the current data exceeds the movement threshold
